bboxes.raw_text:
ALBRITTONS BEAUTY SHOP
1916 E. Monroe
AL 4-35o7

Three appointments affecting
the Arizona organization of
Mountain States Telephone we're
announced by Lawson V. Smith,
vice president and general man
ager.


L. B. Jolly becomes assist
ant vice president Of the utility,
C.M. Walker Is state marketing
manager and H. T. ORourke is
Arizona chief engineer.


Jolly has been with the tele-
phone company since 1925, when
he became a clerk at Salt Lake
City. He first came to Arizona
in 1854 as division directory
manager, and served as state
marketing manager from 1860
until his new appointment, which
fills the vacancy created by the
recent death of Sherman A. Watt.


Walker, who was chief engineer
until his new appointment, is
native of Phoenix. He began his
phone career as a lineman in
1910, and served as a major
with the Army Signal Corps in
the South Pacific during World
War II.


O'Rourke moves up to chief
engineer from state equipment
and building engineer, post he
has held since 1855. He joined the
phone company at Denver as a
frameman in 1927. During World
War II he was Western Electric
technical observer with the Army
Signal Corps in Germany.

NEW YORK - A record
$2,67l,723 was raised by the
United Negro College Fund In
1868. Lawrence ]. MacGregor,
national campaign chairman, an
nounced. Mr.. MacGregor, retired
board chairman of the Summit
Trust Co., Summit, N. j., head
ed the nationwide UNCF appeal
for the second consecutive year.


"The 1868 total tops the
$2.30O.o03 raised in 1862 by l6
percent" Mr.. MacGregor said.
"This Is the largest percentage
TO increase achieved since the
College Fund pioneered coopera-
tive fund raising for higher edu-
cation in 1914. That first year,
$765 1868 was raised to bolster the
operating budgets of the member
institutions.


Corporation giving climbed
the highest last year. amounting
to ST. ,440,6l0. Foundations and
family funds accounted for
$458,652. Individuals and groups
contributed STU, 4o1 to the 1868
campaign


The 80 institutions benefiting
through the appeal are all indie
pendent. privately supported. &C
credited colleges and UNIVERSE
ties. They are located in the IL
southern states.

Did yoW kmoaO that most plastics
become "electrostatic" in molding?
In plain English, that means they
attract dust magnetically.


Therefore, busting with cloth
or buster is ineffective, because the
stirred-up dust simply resettles on
the plastic. The best way to keep
plastic-from housewares to hand
bags = clean is to wash often with
soap or detergent suds.

The Antler Guard Tea In Los
Angeles was great success
and we'll attended.


Our PERC and PDRC meeting
at Yuma was excellent. Grand
district deputy Maple Lee Pratt
conducted a workshop after the
sessions.


Everyone Is invited to attend
the Coronation Ball. Fri, Feb.
%, OIL. donation 81 so.


Don't forget the annual Leap
Year Dance, Sat-. Feb. 10Th.

Electric lighting was lovishIy
used for the first time at the
1898 Chicago Exposition.
Two out of every three Amer
icons still lived on farms.
There we're ~ states with the
total population of 81 million.

James L. Davis


Olive Court No. IL, Heroines
of Jericho, Prince Hall Grand
High Court. California-Arizona
Jurisdiction met Friday. Feb. 81
at the Masonic Temple.


Plans for special Palm Sunday
services we're completed. A visit
from grand lecturer and most
ancient grand matron are ex-
pected on that day.


Mrs. John D. Washington, 924
S. Third Ave-, has been Ill for
several months.

AROUND THE TOWN
James L. Davis

CARPETS INSTALLED and re-
paired Days, evenings, Sundays
Call 275-3O53.

HOUSE FOR SALE
Very Nice Home, 5O24 S. 10th
Place. Low Down, $6,95O-$74
month includes all.

GOLDY'S BEAUTY SHOP
1921 E. Broadway
BR 6-oO83
